With a strong reputation for providing high value solutions this is delivered with a refreshing and dynamic approach, while always maintaining the highest levels of integrity.

jobs.description:
e&e is a dynamic Technology and Business Consultancy specialising in Project

general.headline: Specialist Recruiter | Software / Web Development | 0408 015 653
general.description:
Technical recruitment made simple

We have a comprehensive network of candidates and clients alike and also manage many IT contractors Australia wide.   We do things a bit differently here and try to bring you the genuinely interesting projects in the market. By that we mean working with things like lasers, VR, security, weapons, drones, share trading software, GPS/GPRS tracking, LIDAR, point cloud software, and heaps of rich B2C oriented apps. 

We also help people like you become recognised in the industry and maximise your actual worth.  From a Hiring Manager's perspective, finding and attracting technical candidates can be a challenge and they are seldom found through Seek advertisements. Speak to us on how we can help you confidentially approach and engage the people you need.

 Ask me how the market is looking, what skills are in high demand, what candidates are looking for and how your company is perceived in the current market.  Edison Talent also offers full payrolling services, which can save your company time and money. We also specialise in contracting/temporary employment and consulting.   [QLD Government ICT Provider under SOA 

Number PTD0033-15] (Contract / Permanent / Payroll) 

0408 015 653 
nick@edisontalent.com.au 
www.edisontalent.com.au

general.headline: Managing Director, Nutanix Australia & New Zealand
general.description:
For over 20 years Jamie has provided senior level leadership and management as both an IT Manager and ANZ I APJ focused business manager.

Currently Jamie operates as the Managing Director Australia & New Zealand at Nutanix. In this senior level appointment Jamie has provided leadership through transformation and changing requirements of the business. He has effectively amalgamated sales and technical teams that now achieve fruitful outcomes for the business whilst driving the reputation of Nutanix as a leader within the Australia & New Zealand.

jobs.jobTitle: OEM Alliances Leader | Asia Pacific & Japan
jobs.description:
Leading the Nutanix go-to-market strategy for the Lenovo & IBM OEM business,
      responsible APJ wide for the Enterprise Sales execution and Technical Pre-Sales
      enablement supporting the OEM business and business partners to deliver next
      
      generation solutions.

jobs.jobTitle: Vice President & General Manager  - Asia Pacific & Japan
jobs.description:
Drive and lead the DataCore go-to-market strategy across Asia Pacific & Japan. Responsible for Enterprise Sales, Technical Pre-Sales & Marketing within DataCore, supporting business development to value added re-sellers and partners - enabling customers to deliver next generation business outcomes.

·Changed managed and led Asia Pacific & Japan wide GTM over 2nd Half FY16 for enablement and delivery in FY17.  
·Delivered revolutionary customer experience via restructuring Technical, Sales & Marketing to key vertical’s and partners within APJ.  
·Responsible for P&L across the APJ region driving key investments for growth and profitability.
·Facilitated extensive competitor analysis and benchmarking activities at a product and business levels. 
·Developed strategic execution plans to support GTM utilising competitor activity to support net new business development.
·Key development with alliance partners such as Lenovo, HP & Dell. 
·Executive sponsor APJ wide Lenovo alliance for next generation platforms.

jobs.jobTitle: General Manager & Director - Storage and Data Management
jobs.description:
•	Challenged to drive the amalgamation of technical and sales teams into a single group that focused on providing support in pre and post sales activities across the Dell storage business. Managed the operational as well as cultural challenges to deliver a successful outcome.
•	Developed a highly functional team that provides national support to new and existing clients. Transitioned the business to provide 1 to 1 alignment between sales specialists and technical representatives to further support client engagement as well as increase accountability for technical outcomes and sales success. 
•	Delivered an executive level engagement for the development of numerous take to market strategies. Commended across the business for maintaining a highly strategic approach whilst remaining focused on ongoing success and market share growth. 
•	Personally recognised for contribution to moving Dell from number 5 within the ANZ region to number 2 Q3 FY14 for the storage business. 
•	Facilitated extensive competitor analysis and benchmarking activities at a product and business levels. Utilised competitor activity to support product development.
•	Improved the business through promoting a service over a product based sales approach. Saw this improve engagement with customers resulting in sales and technical representatives taking a strategic approach driving “partnership” within client accounts. 
•	Led numerous technology events and forums as well as delivering key notes and seminars to key industry events. Networked at “C” level during such events whilst responding driving brand awareness and product recognition.
•	Worked at senior executive level within Dell to deliver strategic recommendations and plans within the business. Ensured ongoing alignment between the business structure and Dell strategy working actively with other business managers to improve operational engagements and cross selling opportunities.

•	Led the restructure for the organisation that saw 3 disparate teams be amalgamated
      to become a single technical specialist team with full accountability and responsibility
      across 3 product lines and verticals. Managed across all aspects of organisational and
      
      cultural change ensuring transparent communication and support.

... See more

•	Led the articulation and recommendation of a strategic technical solution that met the specific requirements of the business. Determined the requirements for an enterprise platform that met the unique requirements across 29 districts.
•	Presented the benefits of Enterprise solution stacks inclusive of storage arrays, services, tape libraries and management consoles. Articulated how individual product lines met the businesses backup and recovery strategy, service and support expectations, storage consolidation requirements, data access needs and hardware resource management expectations. 
•	Provided expertise across the effective operation and management of product lines for Dell, HP, SUN, IBM & EMC2. Saw such recommendations increase the acceptance of new technologies over the existing incumbent HP. Aligned the business requirements to the specific capabilities of product lines including the implementation of disaster recovery solutions.
•	Assisted the business through supporting as a 3rd level technical specialist across the environment. Assisted in installation, implementation and upgrade projects providing technical support as well as project leadership. 
•	Supported the articulation of a technological road map that improved the capabilities of the enterprise environment. Operated as a high level enterprise architect and IT management specialist for the statewide business requirements.

•	Appointed to the project to lead the development of a technological solution to meet the ongoing needs of the business. Supported the development of a blue print design for data centre technologies and data centre consolidation.
•	Analysed the integration capabilities of products including Novell Netware, Microsoft SUN Solaris, Oracle, Veritas and hardware platforms consisting of Dell, EMC2, HP, IBM, Brocade and SUN.
•	Led engagements and relationships with external vendors. Operated as the key technical contact for each business whilst engaging effectively with sales and technical specialists. 
•	Operated as a 3rd level contact for all technical issues including new product requirements, software development, fault analysis and monitoring tools. Ensured optimal up time across the network whilst new application development met project requirements and technical specifications for the business.

general.headline: People and Culture Manager at Kloud Solutions ☁️
general.description:
5+ years’ in the recruitment game | Stalker [in a fun, non-creepy way] of the most exceptional cloud talent in Brisbane | Building an iconic team of Kloudies to take over the ☁️ space | Creating a culture they can thrive in [cause they really do deserve it!] | Supporting career development and growth | Having an epic time doing it all 👌🏻

We really pride ourselves on our unique (i.e. awesome!) culture so if you're passionate about all things cloud ☁️ and would like to find out all the perks about this Microsoft Gold Partner & AWS Advanced Consulting Partner, shoot me a message :) 

-----------------------
Snapshot: 
- Recruitment
- Candidate management 
- Human Resources
- Personal branding 
- Business Development
- Coaching and development 
- Strategy and Business planning
- Resume advice 
- Networking 
- Technically savvy

jobs.description:
Since 2010, Kloud have been dedicated to helping organisations switch on the power of the cloud to become more agile, connected and efficient - but we are so much more than that! 

☁️ Microsoft Gold Partner and Enterprise Mobility Partner of 2016 (& Finalist for 2017)
☁️ AWS Advanced Consulting Partner
☁️ Wholly owned subsidiary of Telstra - Part of the BTS Digital arm (We still have our brand + identity) 
☁️ Over 270 Kloudies globally, with many more awesome people to bring on 

In January 2017 our Brisbane office was born 🌈 

If you're a Cloud transformation specialist in any of the below area's, I'd love to chat to see if Kloud (with a K) is where your future could be! - 

Cloud Infrastructure - AWS (Amazon Web Services), Microsoft Azure, DevOps
Cloud Consultants - Office 365, SharePoint Online, Skype for Business, Exchange, AWS, Azure 
Cloud Development - .NET, Azure, APIs , Microservices, UI/UX and Mobile 
Cloud Security - FIM and MIM
Cloud Engineers - Office 365 

samantha.williams@kloud.com.au
www.kloud.com.au

Crowd Delivery was a local Brisbane-born start-up that offers on demand delivery in around 30 minutes. Some of the retailers we delivered from are - Coles, Woolworths, Aldi, McDonalds, KFC, Cold Rock, Pizza Capers, Crust Pizza, Baskin-Robbins, Zambrero + your local Australian owned restaurants, grocers, fresh fruit marts, bakeries and butchers!

I left the business as they went into liquidation.

As the Culture Manager I: 
- Managed all recruitment and HR responsibilities internally
- Provided end to end recruitment across a range of roles including Area Managers, Delivery Drivers, Sales Reps/BDM’s and Developers across Brisbane and the Gold Coast 
- Grew the business from 15 employees to over 70
- Developed and implemented all policies and procedures that were non-existent before starting
- Managed, coached and mentored a Junior Recruiter for 5 months
- Maintained a strong presence on LinkedIn to promote Crowd Delivery 
- Public speaking at Open Days to discuss the opportunities available 
- Managed relationships with various Agency Recruiters  
- Managed the P&L for the Culture team
- On-boarded all new employees and conducted terminations and exit interviews 
- Developed and initialised performance reviews and developed and conducted an employee feedback survey

general.headline: Business Intelligence Consultant at WARDY IT Solutions
general.description:
Expert business intelligence developer using Microsoft SQL Server.  Skilled at designing solutions for all components of a data warehouse from data extraction through to complex analytic modelling.  I bring a strong understanding of software development and a deep appreciation of project management to business intelligence projects.

Specialties: Data Warehouse architecture using Microsoft SQL Server, Intergration Services, Analysis Services OLAP and Data Mining, Reporting Services.  Software development with Microsoft .NET (C# and VB.NET).  Data mining and analytical reporting.

jobs.description:
As a business intelligence consultant I assist organisations to realise the greatest value
      from their data assets.  I specialise in the Microsoft Business Intelligence stack
      
      including SQL Server, Reporting Services, Analysis Services and Master Data Services.

Lead a team of business intelligence developers designing and developing reporting
      solutions for operational policing.  Responsible for the project planning, architecture,
      
      development and delivery of data marts and reporting components.

Key developer role within the QPRIME Information Analysis team to develop a
      green-field data warehouse using SQL Server 2005.  Designed a large scale ETL
      
      solution, developed reports and OLAP cubes.

During my six years tenure at HRM Consulting I contributed to a diverse portfolio of projects in a variety of technical roles.  Roles included software developer, OLAP cube development, technical resource for the Analytics and Consulting team, and finally as a senior information analyst.  A shortlist of my responsibilities include:
•	Developed custom ETL tools used by other Information Analysts,
•	Introduce OLAP cubes, data mining and advanced modelling and simulation to areas where like techniques have rarely been applied,
•	Connect technical and human resource experts together to complete shared goals.

schools.description: Completing a postgraduate course improved my managerial and communication skills while increasing my expertise in data warehousing technologies and data mining.•	Final GPA is 6.5 (with 7.0 highest).•	Data mining assignment, Classification of Maintenance Fault Logs, was published at the AusDM 2008 Data Mining Conference in Adelaide.•	Designed and prototyped a web recommendation system for a commercial web site as a large final year project.  This project extensively used SQL Server Analysis Services including data mining models and DMX queries.

The course focused on solving complex problems with computers and mathematics.  Learnt problem solving skills, how to learn new concepts quickly, and how to work efficiently with others.•	Final year project titled Machine Recognition of Hand Drawn Circuit Diagrams was published at an international conference.

I am an experienced ICT professional who has spent many years behind the keyboard of small and large software houses writing code for corporate clients. I have also managed internal and external development teams across a variety of industries.
 
In 2010 I moved into recruitment and since then I have worked on some of the most challenging and technically complex roles the industry could throw at me. From GPS/GPRS tracking, simulation, immersive, authentication and encryption all the way to mobile apps and responsive design, senior infrastructure and support.
 
I have experience recruiting for a large range of clients from local SMEs, defence to large international conglomerates. I have a strong network of connections and take a proactive approach to networking talent with the right business.
	
I have been recognised for recruiting IT specialists within Software Development and Testing using technologies such as C/C++, Java, Oracle, Delphi, PHP, JavaScript, UI/UX, CSS, SQL, Progress, Windows and Linux to name a few.

Our team is made up of recruiters who know the Australian market after working in

      construction, HR and business support.  And because it’s our business we really care

jobs.jobTitle: Deputy Chair - Women in Mining and Resources Qld Committee
jobs.description:
Women in Mining and Resources Queensland (WIMARQ) is a voluntary, not-for-profit group that organises talks and networking events primarily aimed at bringing together women in many and varied job roles from all areas of the primary resources industry. 

WIMARQ seeks to include people from the mining, exploration, metals processing, oil and gas industries. All are invited including lab technicians, administrative staff, geologists, metallurgists, engineers, operators, government staff, lawyers and human resources staff, amongst others. Women and men from all parts of the mining and resources industry are warmly welcomed to attend for the opportunity to meet others and expand their networks within the industries.

schools.description: HBX Entrepreneurship Essentials is a 4-week, 30-hour online certificate program from Harvard Business School. Entrepreneurship Essentials introduces participants to the entrepreneurial journey from finding an idea to gaining traction in the marketplace to raising capital for a venture. Participants learn an overarching framework—People, Opportunity, Context, Deal—to evaluate opportunities, manage start-ups, and finance ventures.This course also introduces participants to the idea that entrepreneurs run structured experiments to validate ideas and refine business strategy. Participants work through real-world challenges faced by entrepreneurs across a variety of industries, and come away with tangible tools and techniques that they can apply to their own entrepreneurial journeys.

jobs.jobTitle: Director, Head of Intelligent Automation Practice APAC
jobs.description:
We transform businesses through the art of digitization. Our expertise spans multiple disciplines, providing our clients with software solutions that dramatically drive results and outcomes.

Established in 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE:EPAM) is the leading global software engineering and IT consulting provider. 

From 2013 to 2017 Forbes recognized EPAM each year on its Fast Tech 25 list as one of the 25 fastest growing publicly traded technology companies in North America. Forester Research named EPAM as a leader in Digital Platform Engineering space and Product Development Services market and also included into top ten largest Commerce solution providers globally.
Building RPA and AI practice

●	Leading Robotic Process Automation capability within the company resulting in significant business savings and opportunities uncovered. This capability brought our company to top 50 most innovative companies in Australia.
●	Driving agile capability within the company (introduced and adapted story mapping, automated testing, product owners’ forum on a senior management level)
●	Managing Project Portfolio with Agile flavour (5 streams of development teams, 80+ projects per year) with regular reporting and discussing our progress with C-level team
●	Adapted and Implemented a framework for Agile Project Portfolio Management based on XScale approach by Peter Merel. We are comfortably managing delivery across 5 different streams of work with 40+ developers and systems/business analysts in our teams.

●	Implemented sustainable and transparent process of agile project management in the company
●	Adapted agile framework to the needs of traditional project management company, which significantly increased our ability to successfully complete projects and improved our relationships with the clients
●	Successfully leveraged agile virtues within traditional waterfall environment
●	Implemented distant team collaboration using JIRA, Confluence, Google HO and Trello
●	My teams have been able to successfully complete 5 Pega BPM projects (700 to 1000 man/days each) and 1 Metasonic project  (client with over 300 000 employees)

general.headline: RPA Technical Architect | Ex-IBM | Ex-Accenture
general.description:
•	Currently doing my MSc in BigData & Business Intelligence at University of Greenwich, London.
•	Highly capable of recruiting & leading a team towards delivering high profile projects, maintaining the highest coding standards with the fastest TAT using Rapid Application Development Methodology.  
•	Professional Developer Accredited in BluePrism, Automation Anywhere and UiPath.

jobs.description:
1.	Blue Prism – M&T – Records Management Process – Technical Architect
•	As part of Live Proving, successfully released 2 Live Bots in Phase I.
•	Bots get the requests from Email & Web Application, loads into Queue and actions on Statement Extraction, Deposits Extraction or Checks Extraction as requested.
•	Bots reach different data sources like Mainframe; Web and Java applications, download month wise Statements and stores it in the share Drive.
•	Actively involved in the entire RPA SDLC, optimized the Bot efficiency, Load Balancing and stabilized the Bot to withstand any Exception scenario.
•	Started Phase II with the great success hit ratio of Phase I. 

2.	Blue Prism – Travelers – RPA Feasibility – Technical Architect
•	Studied around 48 operational processes with this Insurance client and derived a detailed report of the RPA Feasibility.
•	Proposed to Clients on the FTE benefits, different process methodologies for an increased efficiency, application metrics, Bot solutions, Development Efforts and ROI on Bot deployment.

3.	RPA Academy – COE Lead
•	Organizing sessions on Blue Prism Foundation Training, Blue Prism Advanced Training, Automation Anywhere Foundation Training, UiPath Foundation Training, RPA Best Practices, RPA Testing, Licensing, Load Balancing, Role of RPA Controller and RPA Documentations.
•	As part of this academy, we have a target of training the internal resources, help them getting certified and utilize them on the RPA SDLC.

1.	Automation Anywhere – COE – Tech Lead
•	Worked as a COE Lead in building the Automation Anywhere capability and defining the RPA architecture and RPA documentations for Automation Anywhere.
•	Built a number of POCs for showing the capabilities of Automation Anywhere ranging Complex Deployments.
•	Managed a team of 2 Developers and 1 Business Analyst.

2.	Blue Prism – Carrier Invoice Download Management – Tech Lead
•	As part of the Company Insurance Payment, the due payment files for 10000+ companies are to be downloaded from 15 different Insurance carrier sites and has to process that on a monthly basis.
•	Bot loads all the assigned Process Work Codes from the UI to the BP Work Queue.
•	Based on the Work Code, the corresponding carrier download process gets triggered and downloads the payment bills from the corresponding carrier sites.
•	Once the individual download process gets done, it updates back the success or exception info to the human engineers to carry on the further processes. 
•	Bots are designed for the 24/7 workload with the proper handling of downtimes and remote logins.
•	We achieved the above with the Team strength of 4 and here I played the role of a Tech Lead.

3.	Blue Prism – Time Card Exception – Tech Lead
•	As part of the Team Management, we are supposed to extract certain reports from the Workforce tool which contains the Employee info, position and supervisor details of certain employees falling under the Exception.
•	Based on the requirement, we can download either the standard Supervisor report or the custom report and then process continue with some validation and business logics and sends an Email to the Requestor.
•	The Requirements may vary from 100 ~ 1000 requests / day, so the work load sharing concepts are programmed in the process for the proper utilization of bots.
•	We achieved the above with the Team strength of 3 and here I played the role of a Tech Lead.

jobs.jobTitle: Accenture, Chennai as Software Engineering Analyst
jobs.description:
1.	Blue Prism – Nokia Networks – Alarm Management – Lead Developer
•	NSN is working on Alarm Management for one of the popular Telecom Operators in India.
•	In an event some network/hardware/Infra issues occur in the network, alarm gets triggered in a tool from which the manual efforts are required to analyze the issue, apply some business logics and to raise the concern ticket to different teams to action on them.
•	Out of 15+ alarms, Robots are handling 5 alarm types in all 12 Circles in India.
•	Our RPA process involves 40+ VM Robots designed well enough to handle the overall flow of alarms and to action on them based on priority and within SLA.
•	The tool on which our RPA developed is on Silverlight application with Surface Automation.
•	Project phase includes the BP features like Login Agent, Queue Management, Environmental Variables, Session Variables, Credential store, SQL queries & Procedures, VB code, Environmental Locks, SMTP Integration, Exception Handling Concepts.
•	We achieved the above with the Team strength of 2 and here I played the role of the Lead Developer.

2.	Automation Anywhere – Accenture Operations – Lease Abstraction – Lead Developer
•	10 Lease Clients following the similar Lease Abstraction process – extracting the Lease PDF and fill out the info in different forms manually that are to be viewed by end users.
•	AA will read the XML Web service and breakdown the data to the required info.
•	Then Robot is coded in such a way that it enters the data in different web forms as required.
•	Citrix, MRI, Web, Windows applications are handled by AA in this process.
•	We achieved the above with the Team strength of 2 and here I played the role of the Lead Developer.

jobs.description:
Founded in 2006, Mindfields is a vendor-agnostic Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence advisory firm, providing strategy services to CXO level executives across verticals on emerging and disruptive technologies.

Our experienced consultants leverage Mindfields IP-based proprietary tools and innovative methodologies to advise clients while working as a part of their team to meet their KPIs. We have the experience of automating more than 750 processes across various verticals. 

Gartner and HfS Research has positioned Mindfields as a leading, niche Robotics Process Automation advisory (RPA) firm and we are globally recognized as a thought leader in this space. We have ranked among the top 20 fastest growing Australian firms in the Deloitte Fast 500

With a global presence in Australia, US, Canada, and India, Mindfields’ clients include ING Group, Sensis, Rabo Bank, Equifax, AMP, Suncorp Insurance, CIBC, Broadspectrum, Pepper Money and ANZ Banking Group, which currently employs the biggest robotics work globally.
